definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: In the next three months this relationship took on a more flagrant form.
sentences.chinese: 在以后的三个月里，这种关系显得更加彰明较著了。

sentences.english: They proclaim the splendor of your majesty and recall your wondrous works.
sentences.chinese: 讲述你的威严尊荣，彰明你的奇异化工。

definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
Shanhua town in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
Jente township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
Master Zhu, another name for Zhu Xi 朱熹
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
Yang Xiong (53 BC-18 AD), scholar, poet and lexicographer, author of the first Chinese dialect dictionary 方言[Fang1 yan2]
Chongxin county in Pingliang 平涼|平凉[Ping2 liang2], Gansu
love to all creatures (idiom, from Mencius); universal benevolence
